phases.overview: A violent sandstorm forces the Ares 3 crew to abort their mission. Mark Watney is struck by debris and presumed dead, but he regains consciousness alone on Mars and begins his fight for survival.

sols.quote: “I’m pretty much fucked. That’s my considered opinion. Fucked.”(Weir 3)
sols.summary: Watney wakes up injured after the storm, discovers he’s been left behind, treats his wound, and begins taking stock of his supplies and situation.

phases.overview: Watney focuses on survival, repairing life support systems, developing a food source, and finding ways to generate water.

sols.quote: “Well, I’ve done three EVAs and haven’t found any hint of the communication dish.”(Weir 14)
sols.summary: After searching the area multiple times, Watney confirms that the main communication antenna is destroyed, cutting off contact with NASA.

sols.quote: “I got my undergrad degree at the University of Chicago. Half the people who studied botany were hippies who thought they could return to some natural world system.”(Weir 16)
sols.summary: He explains his background in botany and begins formulating a plan to grow food on Mars using human waste as fertilizer.

sols.quote: “One complication I hadn’t thought of: Water.”(Weir 18)
sols.summary: Watney realizes his potato crops need water and devises a risky plan to generate it by burning hydrazine fuel.

sols.quote: “So I ran into a bunch of problems with my water plan.”(Weir 33)
sols.summary: His first water-creation attempt nearly kills him, but he adjusts the process and finally produces enough to sustain his crops.

sols.quote: “This may be my last entry.” / “Well, I didn’t die.”(Weir 35)
sols.summary: After a near-fatal hydrogen explosion, Watney narrowly survives and continues his mission to grow food.

sols.quote: “I am fucked and I’m gonna die!” / “The Hab is now a bomb.”(Weir 36)
sols.summary: His experiments with hydrazine make the Hab dangerously volatile; he carefully stabilizes the system and prevents disaster.

phases.overview: NASA realizes Watney is alive. Meanwhile, he works to re-establish contact using the old Pathfinder probe.

sols.quote: “The time has come (ominous musical crescendo) for some missions!”(Weir 78)
sols.summary: Watney begins his trek to retrieve Pathfinder, determined to restore communication with Earth.

sols.quote: “Victory! I found it!”(Weir 109)
sols.summary: Watney locates the Pathfinder probe buried in Martian soil, his first major step toward recontacting NASA.

sols.quote: “Seven days since Pathfinder, and seven days closer to home.”(Weir 115)
sols.summary: Watney works tirelessly to repair Pathfinder and prepare for potential contact.

sols.quote: “It worked! / Holy fucking shit it worked!”(Weir 126)
sols.summary: Pathfinder successfully connects with NASA, allowing Watney to communicate with Earth for the first time since the storm.

phases.overview: With communication restored, Watney and NASA collaborate to extend his survival plan and optimize resources.

sols.quote: “The meddling botanists have grudgingly admitted I did a good job. They agree I’ll have enough food to last till Sol 900.”(Weir 141)
sols.summary: Watney’s farming success earns NASA’s approval, confirming that his food supply will last until rescue.

phases.overview: A critical airlock failure destroys his crops, forcing Watney to adapt to new hardships and NASA to plan resupply missions.

sols.quote: “It’s almost time for the second harvest. Ayup. I wish I had a straw hat and some suspenders.”(Weir 162)
sols.summary: Watney prepares for his second potato harvest, proud of his self-sufficiency.

sols.quote: “My conversation with NASA about the Water Reclaimer was boring and riddled with technical details… So I took it apart.”(Weir 166)
sols.summary: Ignoring NASA’s caution, Watney repairs the Water Reclaimer himself, successfully restoring the system.

sols.quote: “The first thing I did today was line up rocks near the rover to spell ‘A-OK’. That should make NASA happy.” / “The farm is dead.”(Weir 185)
sols.summary: A sudden airlock failure kills most of his crops. Watney salvages what remains and resumes rationing food.

sols.quote: “Mars and my stupidity keep trying to kill me.” / “Pathfinder fried with 9 amps. Dead forever. Plan unchanged. Will get to MAV.”(Weir 251)
sols.summary: After a short circuit destroys Pathfinder, Watney loses communication again but decides to continue toward Ares 4.

phases.overview: Watney begins his trek across Mars toward the Ares 4 site, overcoming technical challenges, isolation, and exhaustion.

sols.quote: “Cold night last night. The solar cells were still detached from the farm, so I had to leave the Hab in low-power mode.”(Weir 261)
sols.summary: Watney conserves energy and continues his journey across the Martian terrain.

sols.quote: “I am smiling a great smile. The smile of a man who fucked with his car and didn’t break it.”(Weir 263)
sols.summary: Watney successfully repairs a rover malfunction and continues traveling toward Ares 4.

sols.quote: “Excellent! I hear you are at Mission Control. Was NASA unable to pipe the signal to Bremen?”(Weir 267)
sols.summary: The Hermes crew stays in touch with Earth while preparing for the complex rescue maneuver.

sols.quote: “I’m finally done with the rover modifications!”(Weir 280)
sols.summary: Watney finishes modifying his rover for the last leg of his journey to the Ares 4 MAV.

phases.overview: Watney prepares the Ares 4 MAV for launch as NASA and the Hermes crew execute the Rich Purnell Maneuver to bring him home.

sols.quote: “When I woke up this morning, the trailer hadn’t popped yet. So that was a good start.”(Weir 343)
sols.summary: After a rollover incident, Watney survives and continues final rover checks for launch prep.

sols.quote: “I’d be lying if I said I wasn’t sh*tting myself. In 4 hours, I’m going to ride a giant explosion into orbit.”(Weir 368)
sols.summary: Watney prepares for the MAV launch, nervous but determined to finally leave Mars.

sols.quote: “I’m leaving Mars today, one way or another. About f*cking time.”(Weir 369)
sols.summary: Commander Lewis captures Watney during a high-risk maneuver in orbit, completing his rescue.
